The '''[[2008 NFL season|2008]] [[Kansas City Chiefs]] season''' was the franchise's 49th season, and third with head coach [[Herman Edwards]] at the helm. The Chiefs failed to improve on their 4-12 record from 2007 with the youngest team in the NFL as part of their "youth movement."<ref name="Several '08"/><ref name="Thigpen to start"/><ref name="Interesting list">{{cite web | title=Interesting list of suitors for Hall | url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/blog/index?entryID=3687123&name=clayton_john | last=Clayton | first=John | work=ESPN | date=2008-11-06 | accessdate=2008-11-14}}</ref> The season turned out to be the worst in the franchise's history, by tallying 13 losses for the first time ever.<ref name="Pennington-led"/> The Chiefs' final 2-14 record was the worst in franchise history.<ref name="Johnson wants"/>
The '''[[2008 NFL season|2008]] [[Kansas City Chiefs]] season''' was the franchise's 49th season, and third with head coach [[Herman Edwards]] at the helm. The Chiefs failed to improve on their 4-12 record from 2007 with the youngest team in the NFL as part of their "youth movement."<ref name="Several '08"/><ref name="Thigpen to start"/><ref name="Interesting list">{{cite web | title=Interesting list of suitors for Hall | url=http://sports.espn.go.com/espn/blog/index?entryID=3687123&name=clayton_john | last=Clayton | first=John | work=ESPN | date=2008-11-06 | accessdate=2008-11-14}}</ref> The season turned out to be the worst in the franchise's history, by tallying 13 losses for the first time ever.<ref name="Pennington-led"/> The Chiefs' final 2-14 record was the worst in franchise history.<ref name="Johnson wants"/>
